previous_statement: STRATEGY A3: TERM-BY-TERM ULTRAMETRIC BOUND. In the ultrametric case N(x+y)≤max(N(x),N(y)). Exploit the isosceles property: when N(c₁e₁) ≠ N(αv₃), we get N(v₁)=N(c₁e₁-αv₃)=max(|c₁|,N(αv₃)). Classify parameter space by which terms dominate in each factor and derive C≥1 in each region.
new_statement: STRATEGY A3: TERM-BY-TERM ULTRAMETRIC BOUND (PARTIAL). For ultrametric N_E, the isosceles property gives N_E(v₁)=max(|c₁|, |α|·N_E(v₃)) when |c₁|≠|α|·N_E(v₃), and similarly for v₂. In the non-equality cases, this yields T₁≥|c₁|·N_F(w₁) and T₂≥|c₂|·N_F(w₂), so T₁+T₂≥|c₁|N_F(w₁)+|c₂|N_F(w₂)=collapsed cost≥1 (plus T₃≥0). PROVED for these cases. OPEN: the equality cases |c₁|=|α|·N_E(v₃) and/or |c₂|=|β|·N_E(v₃), where cancellation in N_E(c_j·e_j-multiplier·v₃) can reduce T_j below the collapsed term. The deficit must be compensated by T₃=N_E(v₃)·N_F(αw₁+βw₂). This is the same obstruction as 1.4.2.4 (ultrametric cancellation in w₃) viewed from the v-side. Over non-archimedean fields with dense value group (like ℂ_p), the equality loci are codimension-1 surfaces where the cost minimum likely lives.
